text.div:
This code system http://www.fhir.org/guides/omhtofhir/CodeSystem/omh-datapoint-type defines the following codes:

CodeDisplayDefinition
geoposition GeopositionThe latitude and longitude coordinates of a particular location. (source: https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/geolocation#English)
orientation Gyroscope measurement PanelThe latitude and longitude coordinates of a particular location. (source: https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/geolocation#English)
magnetic_force Magnetic Force Panel2 or 3 axis gyroscopic measurements representing the angular velocity in these axis.
pace PaceThe time it takes to cover a certain distance (km or mile) by some physical activity like walking, running, biking, etc. This is NOT the traditional unit of length of the same name.

name: omh-datapoint-type
title: Open mHealth to FHIR Datapoint Type
description: OMH datapoint schema type the measure an Open mHealth data schema is representing.   These concepts are used were suitable LOINC or SNOMED-CT concepts are not available.

concept.definition: The latitude and longitude coordinates of a particular location.  (source: https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/geolocation#English)
The latitude and longitude coordinates of a particular location.  (source: https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/geolocation#English)
2 or 3 axis gyroscopic measurements representing the angular velocity in these axis.
The time it takes to cover a certain distance (km or mile) by some physical activity like walking, running, biking, etc.  This is NOT the traditional unit of length of the same name.
